Date: 2nd December 2011
Dear Parents,
ISM Christmas Concert Wednesday 14th December 6pm
I am writing to invite you to this years Festive Christmas Concert which will be commencing in the upper school hall at 6pm on Wednesday 14th December. The concert will include performances from school ensembles as well as most year groups/classes throughout ISM.
During the concert there will be an interval where Mulled wine and the nearest thing to a Mince Pie in Moscow will be served.
Students involved will be given a separate letter which will have a permission slip attached to it. All students involved will be welcome to stay at school when the normal day ends at 3:30pm. This year all year groups in Primary and Secondary School except for Year 1 and 4 (due to their recent productions) will be showcasing a performance as a year group and all students in year groups performing are encouraged to take part and perform. Our Foundation Stage students will not be performing due to the late starting time. The concert will also include a few traditional Christmas carols for all to join in. We hope you too will lend your voice to celebrate this special time of the year.
Tickets are now available free of charge on a first come first served basis from Reception on both campuses. In accordance with the school health and fire safety policy there will be an initial limit of 200 tickets available for the concert due to the large numbers of students involved.
We very much look forward to seeing you at the Christmas Concert.
Thank for your continued support and I wish you all a very merry Christmas and happy new year 2012.
Yours Sincerely
James Langford
(Performing Arts Co-ordinator)
Buildings 5 & 6, Krylatskaya Street 12, Krylatskoe, Moscow. 121552
